PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9047 - Managing vSphere 6.0 Deployments and Upgrades
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session will cover VMware's best practices and recommendations for installing, configuring, and upgrading your vCenter Server infrastructure components to best fit your environment. These recommendations are given based on size, scale, and future needs. We'll also go over architectural changes, deployment models, options for migration, and design recommendations. This session will be of interest to administrators of all levels of expertise.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8225 - The vCenter Server and Platform Services Controller Guide to the Galaxy
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware vSphere 6 introduced some significant changes to the VMware vCenter Server and VMware vCenter Single Sign-On architecture. In this session, we'll navigate these changes and discuss best practices for architecting and deploying vCenter Server and the Platform Services Controller. We'll also answer common questions about vCenter Server and Platform Services Controller availability, how to leverage Enhanced Linked Mode, and what design considerations need to be made when architecting your vSphere 6 environments.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9044 - Journey to the vCenter Server Appliance: A Migration Story
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session will cover the available options for migrating from a VMware vCenter Server for Windows to VMware vCenter Server Appliance. We'll go over best practices and provide tips and tricks to guide you safely through this migration journey.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7924 - vRealize Operations Capacity Explained
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Is it important that you know the capacity status of your environment? Is it important to perform capacity planning? Of course it is. But first you need to understand the different capacity and efficiency badges VMware vRealize Operations uses and how they are calculated, as well as the different capacity models. Then you need to know how to use all the data to perform proper capacity management, planning, and forecasting. Hear from a Sr. Staff Specialist at M&T Bank and how he and his team uses vRealize Operations to meet their capacity needs. This session is a must for anyone in a VI admin or capacity management role. Expect a technical session that includes a demonstration.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: CTO9943 - VMware Chief Technology Officer Panel - Trends and Futures
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The role of the Chief Technology Officer is to understand broad technology and business trends, to have deep knowledge of specific technical areas, and through communication, influence and drive the technology direction of specific products, the company and the industry at large. In this panel session the audience will get an opportunity to hear some of the thoughts and opinions, as well as ask questions of VMware's technology leadership.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: CTO7516 - Ask the Experts - Titans of Tech
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Back for it's 9th year at VMworld, Ask the Experts is back with an amazing panel of the industries top experts. In this session there are no powerpoints, no sales pitches and no rules! These panelists have truly shaped the tech industry, and they are here to answer the audiences questions while having some fun in the process. This is completely unscripted, and the audience is in full control. Bring your questions to our panel of experts, learn about what drives their excitement for technology and have some fun while in the process.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF7827 - vSphere DRS Deep Dive: Understanding the Best Practices, Advanced Concepts, and Future Direction of DRS
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware vSphere Distributed Resource Scheduler is the most trusted and widely deployed workload scheduler in the enterprise data center. It's also helping admins achieve unparalleled operational efficiency through automated workload placement, load balancing of clusters for adapting to changing workloads, and efficient evacuation capabilities for reducing downtime during maintenance and upgrades. In this session, we will discuss some best practices surrounding DRS aggressiveness and fine-tuning the load-balancing settings. We will also cover topics such as cost-benefit analysis and factors/constraints that influence DRS decisions. From there, we will dive into advanced concepts related to resource pools and controls and affinity/anti-affinity rules. Last of all, we will close with a discussion about the future direction of DRS.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8468 - A Beginner's Guide to the Software-Defined Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Welcome to the Software-Defined Data Center. Learn how to achieve secure, rapid delivery of infrastructure and applications in your on-premises data center with the same ease of use, scale, and cost that is available in the public cloud. We start with an overview of the core SDDC building blocks, to include compute virtualization (vSphere), software-defined storage (VSAN/VVOLs), and software-defined networking (vSphere Distributed Switch + NSX). We then look at how combining monitoring together with management and automation (vRealize Suite) enables IT organizations to realize the benefits of self-service along with the secure, rapid delivery of infrastructure, applications, and services across the private cloud.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8203 - Beyond the Marketing: Horizon Instant Clones Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Horizon instant clones are the new and exciting technology for provisioning desktop pools in Horizon platforms. This rapid provisioning method, which leverages vmFork technology, enables the next generation of just-in-time desktops. Coupled with AppVolumes and VMware User Environment Manager, it enables a persistent user experience. This technical deep dive will explore the architectural components of instant clones in depth. Requirements, installation, provisioning workflows, and scalability of instant clones will be examined.  We will provide troubleshooting tips and operational best practices. The session will be led by architects with product experience, and there will be a demo so you can see instant clones in action.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8755R - Troubleshooting vSphere 6: Tips and Tricks for the Real World
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware vSphere is the industry-leading virtualization platform. Understanding how to use critical troubleshooting techniques is key to improving the performance and reliability of your vSphere environment. Join us for a deep dive and explore troubleshooting tools that include the use of the vSphere Command Line Interface, the VMware ESXi shell, and log files to diagnose and correct problems. We will also explore specific commands you can use to resolve networking and storage issues as well as vSphere High Availability cluster and performance issues.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8089 - Extreme Performance Series: vSphere Compute and Memory
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session, the speaker will discuss the details of compute and memory schedulers focusing on virtual machine sizing and performance. The goal is to help you make the best decisions on provisioning, understand a performance problem, and resolve it. If you want to learn specifics about ready/co-stop time, virtual NUMA, virtual socket, or large page, you don't want to miss this advanced session.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: CNA7522 - Containers for the vSphere Admin
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Containers, Docker, and Kubernetes, just to name a few, are probably some words floating around the water cooler lately. What does it all mean, and how does it apply to your job as a VMware vSphere admin? How can you support these new technologies with current investments? Hear live from a former vSphere admin, who will explain containers and the surrounding technologies in easy-to-understand terms as well as how you can leverage VMware to embrace these new offerings.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8430 - vSphere 6.x Host Resource Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Today's focus is on upper levels/overlays (Software-Defined Data Center stack, VMware NSX, and cloud), but proper host design and management still remains the foundation of success. With the introduction of these new "overlay" services, we are presented with a new consumer of host resources. Ironically, it's the attention to these abstraction layers that returns us to focusing on individual host components. Correct selection and configuration of these physical components lead to creating a stable high-performing platform, which lays the foundation for the higher services and increased consolidating ratios. This talk goes into details of physical host resource components, such as CPU (NUMA), memory configuration, and next-gen storage components. It also zooms in on how virtual networking and storage services influence virtual machine configuration and physical host design. Info provided in this talk allows you to get better grips on sizing your virtual data center for today's high-demand workloads, network overlays, and next-gen storage services.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8243R - Troubleshooting 101 for Horizon
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Have you run into a problem in your virtual desktop environment? Do you have a virtual machine that is not responding? Are users calling nonstop and interfering with your Halo sessions? Are you pulling out your hair? Learn the skills and tools you need to troubleshoot the top 10 issues (as per the VMware Global Support Service top 10 list) from the best instructors in the industry. In this session you will learn how to start troubleshooting problems and what tools to use to troubleshoot issues relating to VMware Horizon. Areas to be covered will include automated pools (full clones, linked clones, and instant clones) as well as storage and network (PCoIP, RDP, Blast/Blast Extreme Experience).

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9461-SPO - Veeam Availability Suite 9.5 Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Join us for a deep dive into NEW Veeam® Availability Suite™ 9.5. Anton Gostev (@Gostev) and Doug Hazelman (@VMDoug) will introduce 9.5 new features and enhancements designed to enable the Always-On Enterprise™. Don’t miss this breakout to learn more about Veeam new integration with Nimble storage snapshots, as well as how Veeam advanced ReFS integration sets new standards in VMware backup performance and reliability while significantly reducing disk space usage. Also, learn more about our new, deep integration with VMware vCloud Director as well as our major architectural and scalability improvements for the VMware enterprises. Stick around, because the session will also cover important details on the enhancements made to our line of Veeam Explorers™ to support 2016 updates of major enterprise applications and our latest advancements in primary and secondary storage support. Finally, last but not least, be the first to hear a quick update on what other new Availability innovations Veeam plans to unveil later in the year!

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7907 - Advanced Network Services with NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Applications are everywhere and always more complex: they require much more than switching and routing on the network side. Clouds should be able to host any applications, including the complex ones. This session will discuss the concepts for designing and operating NSX network services such as firewalling, load balancing and VPN. We will examine and explain some ideas in how you can better consume those services by automating them or by using other mechanisms such as NSX API. You will leave the session with a better understanding on how NSX Network and Security services work and how to leverage those to better support your applications. In addition with its distributed model of network services, NSX can scale to the most demanding applications and thus support your most complex and high-demanding applications.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8364R - How to Deploy VMware NSX with Cisco Infrastructure
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Many enterprises rely on both VMware vSphere and Cisco Nexus/UCS to build the foundation of their data center infrastructure. While VMware NSX brings advanced network automation and security capabilities to vSphere on any network infrastructure, this session will cover the NSX design considerations specific to environments using Cisco Nexus switches for the physical network, and Cisco UCS for the vSphere compute resources. This session will also show how to run NSX while utilizing the underlay functionality of Cisco ACI. The session will provide a review of the most important topics from the two VMware NSX + Cisco Nexus/ACI design guides already published, while adding additional “lessons learned” from real deployments in the field since those publications.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8092 - The Power Hour: Deep Dive, DevOps, and New Features of PowerCLI
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Alan and Luc will, once more, present you with a state of the union for PowerCLI, discussing what's new, what's changed, and what it means for you. Be sure to attend for exciting news and tech preview features and demonstrations. With the rise of all things DevOps, this session will also show you the latest state of the community-driven VMware vSphere DSC resources, including why and how to use them, what they are, and what's in store. Back by popular demand, the session will again be filled with best practices, including fast(er) statistical reports and assigning SCSI IDs and payment card industry slot numbers. This is the part of our sessions where you can get quick wins. Don't reinvent the wheel, just copy our code!

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9617-SPO - Containers & VVols - a technical deep dive on new technologies that revolutionize storage for vSphere
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Containers and Virtual Volumes (VVols) are two hot new storage technologies that bring storage focus down to the VM and application level. This technical deep dive will get you started with all the key information that you need to know to get a better understanding of Containers and VVols. VVols has been available for over a year now and represents significant innovation by changing the way that VMs interact with shared storage but at the same time VVols introduces many new storage concepts and terminology such as Protocol Endpoints, Storage Containers and VASA Providers. The goal of this session is to provide you with all the key information that you will need to know before implementing VVols in your own environment such as an introduction to the VVols architecture components, understanding capabilities and storage policies, benefits and improved efficiency of VVols compared to VMFS, preview of the new replication functionality in the next VASA release and finally planning considerations and migration strategies. Container virtualization technology brings an innovative approach to bundling, running and managing applications in a highly portable manner. In this session we explore Containers, starting with what they are, their origins, and why they are so popular. The goal of this session is to prepare you with insights to help develop a persistent storage container strategy that best fits your environment. In this information-packed session you will learn why Containers are interesting for developers and IT operations, how to take a data-centric approach to Containerizing applications, how Containers and storage integrate, what deployment scenarios are available for Containers with persistent storage and finally customer use cases for containers with storage

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8290R - Monster VMs (Database Virtualization) Doing IT Right
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Databases by their very nature are Monster VMs. If Monster VMs are not virtualized properly, they will never perform well and can negatively impact the performance of other VMs on the hosts. In this presentation, we teach you how to properly virtualize Monster VM Databases. We will discuss why you virtualize, installation issues, how to architect for performance, the storage layer, the processor, memory considerations, and the network layer. Topics include NUMA, memory reservations, and how to avoid common mistakes. Lesson learned here help you optimize any workload you are virtualizing, with special emphasis on Monster VMs.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8404 - What's New with Horizon 7
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Do faster desktop provisioning, improved management capabilities, enhanced scalability, and better user experience for desktops and applications pique your interest? If so, you will be interested to hear about VMware Horizon 7, which provides a plethora of new capabilities such as just-in-time desktops, smart policies, enhanced cloud pod architecture (CPA), and continued innovation for remote desktop session host desktops and applications. Additionally, Blast Extreme provides a new protocol built for the mobile cloud era. This session will be of interest to administrators of all levels and expertise.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT7718 - The KISS of vRealize Operations!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: How can you troubleshoot across the multiple domains, applications, and infrastructure layers? It's not easy without the right tools, but with VMware vRealize Operations you can do it. Some feel that vRealize Operations can sometimes be overly "expert friendly" and overwhelming. We will dispel that myth and help you recognize the power and simplicity of vRealize Operations through demonstrations. A technical session with very few slides, this is a must for anyone in a VI admin or "firefighting" role.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7621 - Virtualize Active Directory, the Right Way!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Active Directory Domain Services (ADDS) allows organizations to deploy a scalable and secure directory service for managing users, resources, and applications. Virtualization of ADDS has been supported for many years now, however has required careful management to avoid pitfalls around replication, time management, and access. While Windows Server 2012 provides greater support for virtualization by including virtualization-safe features and support for rapid domain controller deployment, Windows Server 2016 added more virtualization, and cloud-focused security enhancements with features such as "Host Guardian" Service, "Shielded VM," etc. On the vSphere side, VMware introduces its enhanced security feature (VM Encryption for vSphere and vCloud Air - VMCrypt): persistent, OS-agnostic VM data encryption across the virtual infrastructure.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET9989-S - NSX - The Network Bridge to the Multi-cloud Future
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Networking is undergoing fundamental change to support tomorrow application infrastructures, hosted across hypervisors and living partly on-premise and partly across multiple public clouds, joining both traditional and third platform architectures. NSX delivers network virtualization capabilities today, but the future of NSX is even brighter: connecting public clouds and containers and delivered as a service. Join NSX Chief Technology Strategy Officer Guido Appenzeller for a preview into what lies ahead for NSX and network virtualization.

Presenters.Name: ISAO EGUCHI, Nomura Research Institute, Ltd.
Presenters.LastName: ISAO EGUCHI, Nomura Research Institute, Ltd.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8036 - Enforcing a vSphere Cluster Design with PowerCLI Automation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The amount of VMware vSphere data center, cluster, storage, and network options available to an administrator is massive. Even specific features such as High Availability and the Distributed Resource Scheduler have a ton of different configuration settings provided to meet the needs of your specific virtualized workloads. It can be a challenge, however, to audit the settings and best understand why they were set in the first place—especially as other administrators join and leave your organization! Join VMware's Duncan Epping, author of the infamous Cluster Deep Dive series, along with Rubrik's Chris Wahl, PowerShell MVP and author of Networking for VMware Administrators, as they take a look at how to abstract vSphere configuration settings into declarative configuration files. Learn how to audit, track, and enforce consistent settings—with notes and comments—to ensure the availability and standardization of your vSphere environment.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF9083 - Ask the vCenter Server Experts Panel
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Curious about the deepest, darkest secrets of VMware vCenter Server? Attend this panel discussion with vCenter experts and engage in an open Q&A with some candid stories of the vCenter Server evolution. You'll also hear some tidbits about the future of vCenter Server. The diverse set of panelists includes R&D Director Dilpreet Bindra, vCenter Server gurus Emad Younis and Adam Eckerle, Technical Marketing Architect Ryan Johnson, and SDDC Integration Architect Blair Fritz. We'll field questions from the audience and provide our own experiences to help customers walk away with a better understanding of vCenter Server, its operations, and upgrade stories.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7645 - Virtual Volumes Technical Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Virtual Volumes (VVol) is a framework developed by VMware and partners in the storage industry to transform the way VMs are stored by enabling VM-awareness on arrays. VVols eliminate static storage constraints by removing LUNs, filesystems, and volumes, and giving the array direct visibility and understanding of the VM objects they store. This enables a flexible policy based approach to storing and managing VMs without traditional concerns about capability and capacity management bounded by LUNs on the physical infrastructure. Learn about this revolutionary change in the way storage is delivered to VMware environments, and how this industry-wide initiative will allow you an efficient and intelligent new way to use your storage arrays.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8038 - Getting Started with PowerShell and PowerCLI for Your VMware Environment
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware PowerCLI Module is one of the most complete, mature, and widely adopted extensions to the PowerShell framework. It includes a plethora of functions that abstract the vSphere API down to simple and powerful cmdlets for operating your vSphere environment. For those new to the concepts of scripting and automation, getting your feet wet into PowerCLI can be daunting. After all, no one wants to accidentally explode their data center with a few errant keystrokes! Join VMware Kyle Ruddy, Senior Technical Marketing Engineer, along with Rubrik Chris Wahl, Microsoft PowerShell MVP, as they arm you for success with PowerShell and PowerCLI. You’ll learn how modules, snapins, functions, and scripts relate to one another, how to install and configure your PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment, setup a profile, and begin writing PowerCLI scripts using safe, non-destructive starter code. We’ll also dive into exploring objects, extension data, and perform simple logic statements.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9424-S - Taking HCI Mainstream
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Hyper-converged infrastructure (HCI) is now being deployed at scale across virtualized environments. This session covers the market dynamics and product features that are accelerating adoption. Learn about key architectural aspects that drive efficiency, flexibility and cost-savings along with what's next for VMware's HCI vision.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7601 - Advances in Remote Display Protocol Technology with VMware Blast Extreme
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Learn about the advances in remote protocol technology with Blast Extreme. This technical session will provide a technical deep dive of the Blast Extreme protocol, Blast Extreme optimization with graphics technology partners (Intel, Nvidia, and AMD), and resourceful tips for fine-tuning various GPO parameters to deliver the best user experience in both LAN and WAN environments. This session will also compare and contrast performance of the Blast Extreme protocol and PCoIP.
